description: '''Moritz von Oswald''' (born 1962) is a German record producer and percussionist from [[Hamburg]] and based in [[Berlin]]. He is a co-founder of the production duo and record label [[Basic Channel]]. He has collaborated with [[Juan Atkins]], [[Carl Craig]], and [[Nils Petter Molv√¶r]]. He also leads the Moritz von Oswald Trio, which has featured musicians such as [[Vladislav Delay]], [[Tony Allen (musician)|Tony Allen]], and [[Laurel Halo]]. ''[[The Stranger (newspaper)|The Stranger]]'' called him "one of the master architects of [[dub techno]]".
